summary.para: Get a pointer to a variable that contains sampler state.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of sampler descriptions. If there is only one sampler variable in the effect, use 0.

param.name: pSamplerDesc
param.para: A pointer to a sampler description (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Get a pointer to a sampler interface.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of sampler interfaces. If there is only one sampler interface, use 0.

param.name: ppSampler
param.para: The address of a pointer to a sampler interface (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: A sampler interface accesses sampler state.

remarks.para: An ID3D10EffectSamplerVariable Interface is created when an effect is read into memory.

Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. You can use either of these methods to return state. For examples, see Two Ways to Get the State in an Effect Variable.
